content.text:
# List of wars involving Tunisia

This is a list of wars involving the Republic of Tunisia and its predecessor states.
Hafsid dynasty (1229–1574)

|Result

|style="background:#efefef"|  Tunis  Malta
|style="background:#efefef"|  Algiers
}}
| style="background:#FF8080" | Algerian victory
* Capture of Tunis
* Tunis becomes a tributary of Algiers
* Tunis recognises the suzerainty of the Dey of Algiers
* Tunis becomes a tributary of Algiers and recognises Algerian suzerainty for more than 50 years
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Tunisian-Venetian War(1784–1792)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Beylik of Tunis
|style="background:#efefef"|  Republic of Venice
|style="background:#80FF00"| Victory
* Tunisia victory. Republic of Venice pays huge compensation to Tunisia.
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| 1793–95 Tripolitanian Civil War(1793–1795)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Karamanli dynasty supporters23px Beylik of Tunis
|style="background:#efefef"|  Tripolitania Eyalet
|style="background:#80FF00"| Victory
* Karamanli dynasty restored to the throne of Tripolitania
* Weakening of Ottoman rule over Tripolitania
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Tunisian-Algerian War (1807)(1807)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Beylik of Tunis
|style="background:#efefef"|  Deylik of Algiers
*  Beylik of Constantine
|style="background:#80FF00"| Victory
* Tunisian victory.
* Complete liberation from the guardianship of The Dey of Algeria
* Stabilization of the border
|-

|style="background:#efefef"| Battle of Wazzin(2011)Part of the 2011 Nafusa Mountains Campaign
|style="background:#efefef"|  Anti-Gaddafi forces
*National Liberation Army
*Tunisian Army
*Tunisian Police
|style="background:#efefef"|  Libyan Arab Jamahiriya
|style="background:#80FF00"| Anti-Gaddafi victory
*Loyalist forces occasionally shelled the crossing for months afterward.
*Fighting ongoing after the Libyan Army clashes with the Tunisian Army
*Rebel forces capture Wazzin on 21 April.
*Loyalist forces retake the border crossing on 28 April.
*Rebels retake Wazzin on 4 May
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Chaambi Operations(2012–2019)Part of the insurgency in the Maghreb
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|  Ansar al-Sharia AQIM Uqba ibn Nafi Brigade
|style="background:#80FF00"| Tunisian victory
* Tunisian National Guard eliminates Okba Ibn Nafaa commanders on 28 March 2015 and continues to eliminate many more afterwards.
* Declaration of certain mountain areas as military locked zones that require prior authorization to enter for non-military entities.
|-
